description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger 41 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Orange-brown paper with laid and chain lines visible. Collation notes (see collation statement fol. 13b). On fol. 2a: Several ownership statements and other inscriptions. Title on the lower edge of the text block (hardly legible). Foliation in black ink using Arabic numerals on the verso of each leaf. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Fol. 35 and 49: red thread attached to the leaf. Collation: Paper; fol. 126: i (endleaf; European paper with watermark) 1-12¹⁰ 13⁶ + i (endleaf; same paper). The quires are numbered using Arabic numerals. Small marks on the lower outer corner and upper outer corner of the opposite page indicating the middle of quires (see fol. 5b-6a). Copied by Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Laṭīf (fol. 126b) in Jumādá al-Thānī(?) 810 (text 1, see fol. 124a) and Rajab 815 (texts 3 and 4, see fol. 126a and b).
author: Qayṣarī, Dāwūd ibn Maḥmūd, d. 1350 or 51.
abstract: Commentary on the Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam by Ibn al-ʻArabī, followed by three short texts.
contents: 6. fol. 126a-b: Sharḥ suʼāl Kumayl ibn Ziyād li-Amīr al-Muʼminīn / ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Qāshānī.
extent: ii, 126, ii leaves : paper ; 272 x 183 (210 x 129) mm. bound to 285 x 195 mm.
title: Sharḥ al-Fuṣūṣ ... [etc.].
provenance: Several ownership statements on fol. 1a and 2a, including one in the name of Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir, dated 1285 H. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: قيصري، داوود بن محمود
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Yellow and brown marbled paper pasted on pasteboards. Red paper pastedowns and fly-leaf.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
